title: Sketch Dev Internship
description: During my 6-month internship at Sketch Development, my fellow interns and I migrated Jira plugins and databases from Heroku to AWS, Dockerized applications, fixed bugs, and documented the process, ensuring a smooth transition to the development team.

title: Pursuit Alert
description: Open source full stack counter surveillance application that detects vehicles that may be following you using ALPR. Dockerized for arm and x86 system architectures.

title: Antarctic Intelligence
description: I designed and developed the website for Antarctic Intelligence, a consulting firm, leveraging Squarespace to ensure a professional and user-friendly online presence.

title: MODOT Counter
description: Simple computer vision application that counts the number of vehicles seen on the Missouri Department of Transportation's public highway cameras.

title: Goblin Code
description: For the Missouri Hacks 2024 Competition at Mizzou, I developed a python game that earned me the Creativity Prize and a $25 award, competing against 31 other participants.

title: IXL Bot
description: I created a bot to do my 10th grade math homework for me. The program utilizes OpenAI's API and Selenium to autonomously read, solve, and answer each question.

title: Troop 677 Website
description: Over a year, I led a team to redesign our Boy Scout Troop's website, enhancing it with custom CSS, JavaScript, and HTML on Troop Web Host. This experience sharpened my leadership and web development skills.
